But the whole reason to look at the average CRM price target in the first place is to tap into a "wisdom of crowds" effort, putting together the contributions of all the individual minds who contributed to the ultimate number, as opposed to what just one particular expert believes. And so with CRM crossing above that average target price of $202.08/share, investors in CRM have been given a good signal to spend fresh time assessing the company and deciding for themselves: is $202.08 just one stop on the way to an even higher target, or has the valuation gotten stretched to the point where it is time to think about taking some chips off the table?
